page.title: 12NOTABLE BUILDINGS (CONT.)
page.content:
On Dick Brook at the foot of the road known as{The Toot}is a picturesque old{corn mill}recently restored as a dwelling. It was known as{THE PRIOR'S MILL. { { ASTLEY HALL,}built in the l830's, was the home of former{Prime Minister} {STANLEY BALDWIN. }After his death the house became a school for needy boys from Birmingham through a bequest in his will. In 1978 it was sold and is now a private nursing home for the elderly.
At the foot of{Bull Hill,}about a quarter of a mile away on the Stourport road, is a{memorial}to Stanley Baldwin. This was officially unveiled by Sir Winston Churchill.
